item.description:
The Boston Independence Day Tea Party will be at the Parkman Bandstand on Boston Common and Christopher Columbus Park on Boston Harbor just steps away from the original Boston Tea Party!

Right now the schedule is as follows:



  • 10 am to Noon - Guided tours of the Freedom Trail
  • Noon to 2 pm Speakers Program - Boston Common
  • 3 pm to 4 pm Live Entertainment - At Christopher Columbus Park
  • Miss Boston USA, Lacy Folger singing the National Anthem
  • 4 pm to 6 pm Afternoon Speakers Program


Speakers scheduled to appear:


  • Todd Feinburg - WRKO 680 AM
  • Carla Howell - Center for Limited Government
  • Barry Hinkley - Mass FairTax
  • Brad Marston - ConservativeSolutions.org
  • Sheridan Folger - SovereigntyAlliance.org
  • Paul Jehle as Joseph Warren of the Original Boston Tea Party
  • Dr. Yaron Brook - Ayn Rand Institute
  • Kamal Jain - Mass-Truth.org
  • Mike McShane - KillingOurJobs.org
  • Mike Kelleher - CloseTheTolls.org
  • Jason Healey - Jellybean Coalition
  • Ralph Benko - Author of The WEBster's Dictionary
  • Jim Stergios - Pioneer Institute
  • Jim Bohn - Economist
  • Jack Marino - Conservative Film Maker
  • Doug Bennett - Candidate for Boston City Council
  • John Ridpath - Ayn Rand Institute
  • Jim Wallace - Gun Owners Action League
  • Sean Ryan - Candidate for Boston City Council
  • Dave Kopacz - Mass. Liberty Preservation Alliance
  • Honorable Dan Itse - National Heritage Center for Constitutional Studies
  • Dr. John Lewis - Duke University


For more information and opportunities to volunteer for organizing this event please visit BostonTeaParty.com
item.how_to_find_us: We will be at Boston Common at noon. Christopher Columbus Park at 3 pm.
item.name: Boston Independence Day Tea Party
